Description: Rim and mouth sherd of Corinthian, probably black-figured, pottery globular aryballos with part of neck; exterior: painted black inside mouth; on top of mouth four bands, on edge two; neck reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a discussion on the decoration on top of mouth, see Payne 1931, 319.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 39, pl. XXIII, no. 25)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.138) (Phase 1)
